#OnThisDay 20/12/1937 While escorting Japanese officers on an inspection tour of Ginling, Minnie Vautrin receives word that Japanese soldiers are trying to haul away women in another building. The inspecting officers do nothing more than issue a reprimand. 
#WWII #NanjingMassacre

#OnThisDay 18/12/1937 Minnie Vautrin visits the Japanese Embassy where she is met by an “understanding and distressed” consul, Mr Tanaka, who provides notices to post at the Ginling College gates, supposedly to ward off Japanese soldiers.
#WWII #NanjingMassacre #南京大屠殺 #China

#OnThisDay 22/12/1937 John Rabe learns the fate of 43 of the city’s electric plant workers. Having stayed in Hsiakwan to maintain service, the Japanese discovered them some days ago and led them down to the river’s edge for execution.
#China #WWII #NanjingMassacre #南京大屠殺

#China #WWII #NanjingMassacre
